text: Edward Joseph Mahoney (March 21, 1949 â€“ September 13, 2019), known professionally as Eddie Money, was an American singer-songwriter and multi- instrumentalist. He was popular during the 1970s and 1980s. He was born in New York City, but raised in Berkeley, California. Money was well known for songs like "Baby Hold On", "Two Tickets to Paradise", "Maybe I'm a Fool", "Think I'm in Love", "Shakin'", "Take Me Home Tonight", "I Wanna Go Back", "Walk on Water", "The Love in Your Eyes", and "Peace in Our Time". In August 2019, Money was diagnosed with stage 4 esophageal cancer. On September 13, 2019, he died from the cancer and from heart valve surgery-related problems at his home in Los Angeles at age 70."Eddie Money dies at 70" ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1949 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American rock guitarists Category:American rock singers Category:American keyboardists Category:American saxophonists Category:American pop singers Category:American pop musicians Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:Musicians from Berkeley, California Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Singers from Berkeley, California Category:Singer-songwriters from New York City Category:Singer-songwriters from California Category:Writers from Berkeley, California Category:Deaths from esophageal cancer Category:Deaths from surgical complications
title: Eddie Money
